ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But he has not braved the steep ascent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But he could not scale the steep ascent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But he did not venture to scale the difficult steep.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Yet, he has not entered into Aqaba
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So he did not quickly enter the steep valley.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But he has not attempted to pass on the path that is steep.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But he would not attempt the uphill road,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Yet he has not assaulted the steep;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But he hath not attempted the Ascent -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But he has not attempted the ascent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Yet he attempteth not the steep,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Yet he has not embarked upon the uphill task.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But he hath made no haste on the path that is steep.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But he has made no effort to pass on the path that is steep.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Yet he has not scaled the height.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But he did not brave the ascent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [90:11] Yet why does he not assault the obstacle?, [why] does he [not] surmount it?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But he hath not attempted the Ascent) He says: but did he go beyond that hurdle which is the Bridge over hell?
